conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: extruded walls with thickness, visible top/side faces, angled/isometric viewpoint, and ceiling removed to expose interior volumes.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with readable corner geometry and clear floor-vs-wall separation; cutaway is clean with only minor simplification in some interior wall tops.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall apartment footprint and major zones (living, kitchen/dining, bedrooms, bath) generally match, but the small top-center/right study/utility room from the 2D plan appears missing/merged into a larger bathroom area, altering partitions and adjacency.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (beds, sofa set, dining table, kitchen counters). Bathroom fixtures exist but differ from plan (plan shows shower + toilet; render shows a larger bath area with additional/changed fixtures and no clear separate study furniture).

visual_clarity.notes: Walls, openings, and rooms are clearly readable; lighting and materials are consistent with minimal artifacts and clean presentation.

detected_errors.description: A distinct small room in the 2D plan (top center/right with desk) is not preserved as a separate enclosed space in the 3D render, indicating a merged/missing room and shifted partitions.
Some door/opening placements and swing indications are simplified compared to the 2D plan, reducing fidelity of exact opening geometry.
Study/desk area furniture/room identity from the 2D plan is not clearly represented in the corresponding location.

summary: True 3D cutaway with strong volumetric modeling, but with a notable layout fidelity issue where a small room is merged/omitted, reducing geometric accuracy versus the 2D plan.
